body.header: Read these pieces of advice for IELTS Writing Task 1 and decide which of them are things you should do.

p.b: 1. What should you do before you write?
p.g: A Decide which figures are not important enough to mention in your report.
B Spend time carefully reading any titles, axes, labels and legends before you start writing.
C Spend time looking for the main trends before you start writing.
D Spend time planning the most appropriate order in which to present the information.
E Plan to leave some time at the end to check your report for mistakes.
F Ask questions about anything you have not understood.
G Try to remember anything you have read about the subject before.

p.b: 2. What should you do while you are writing?
p.g: A Copy the question and use it as your opening sentence.
B Divide your report into paragraphs.
C End your report with one or two sentences summarising the most important trends.
D Include a paragraph with your personal opinions about the topic.
E Spend more than 20 minutes on Writing Task 1.
F Start writing immediately.
G Write a minimum of 150 words.

p.b: 3. What type of language should you use?
p.g: A Use a linking word or phrase between every sentence.
B Use a range of grammatical structures and vocabulary.
C Use contractions.
D Use formal language.
E Use linking words and phrases between sentences and paragraphs where appropriate.
F Vary the way you describe figures by using percentages, fractions and ratios.
G Refer to the figures.

p.b: 4. What should you do with the diagrams, charts, graphs and tables?
p.g: A Add extra information you may know about the topic but which is not included in the diagram, chart, graph or table.
B Always describe charts, graphs and tables from left to right or top to bottom.
C Include every figure from the chart, graph or table in your report.
D Round figures up or down where appropriate.
E Summarise overall trends first and then describe any important specific features.
F Write a short introduction briefly explaining what the diagram, chart, graph or table shows.
G Speculate on possible reasons for the trends and patterns shown in the chart, graph or table.
